casebody.data:
STATE
v.
Rayford Lewis BURKE 181A93-4 Supreme Court of North Carolina. February 19, 2019 Franklin E. Wells, Jr., Attorney at Law, Asheboro, Gretchen Engel, Attorney at Law, Malcolm Ray Hunter, Jr., Attorney at Law, Durham, for Burke, Rayford Lewis Danielle Marquis Elder, Special Deputy Attorney General, Mikko Red Arrow, Assistant District Attorney, Jonathan Babb, Special Deputy Attorney General, Jonathan P. Babb, Special Counsel to Attorney General, for State of N.C. Christopher A. Brook, Legal Director, Burton Craige, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, James Coleman, Attorney at Law, Irving Joyner, Attorney at Law, Durham, Cassandra Stubbs, Attorney at Law, for ACLU Capital Punishment Project, et al. Carlos E. Mahoney, Attorney at Law, Durham, for NAACP Legal Defense and Educational Fund, Inc. Brian W. Stull, Attorney at Law, Henderson Hill, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for Promise of Justice Initiative, et al. Sarah Kirkman, District Attorney, for State of N.C. The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 15th of February 2019 by Amicus to admit W. Kerrel Murray Pro Hac Vice: "Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 19th of February 2019." Ervin, J. recused
